issues.description: VocabCard words are in Romanian instead of English (the target language). Translations are in English instead of Romanian. The language direction is reversed for multiple VocabCards.
issues.evidence: word="La multi ani!" translation="Happy Birthday!" — word should be English, translation should be Romanian

issues.description: PhraseOfDay has word in Romanian and translation in English — reversed. Should be word="Happy Birthday, my love!" translation="La multi ani, iubirea mea!"
issues.evidence: word="La multi ani, iubirea mea!" translation="Happy Birthday, my love!"

issues.description: Multiple VocabCards have descriptive labels instead of actual phonetic pronunciations. These provide zero learning value.
issues.evidence: pronunciation="urare speciala", "urare clasica", "urare calda", "romantic", "intentie romantica"

issues.description: Contains [Numele tau] placeholder in the letter template that should be replaced or removed.
issues.evidence:
Cu toata dragostea,
[Numele tau]

issues.description: Multiple long paragraphs of academic filler that describe what the section will cover rather than teaching anything. These read like AI-generated meta-commentary about the article structure itself.
issues.evidence: Exprimarea sentimentelor profunde in limba engleza necesita o selectie atenta a vocabularului...

issues.description: Article claims to teach English birthday wishes but the bulk text, bullet points, and many VocabCards are entirely in Romanian with no English equivalents. The article barely teaches English.
issues.evidence: Bullet points like 'La multi ani celui mai minunat om din lume!' have no English translation

issues.description: MDX content uses VocabCard, CultureTip, and PhraseOfDay components but has no import statements at the top of the file.
issues.evidence: Content starts with prose text directly, no import statements

issues.description: Internal link missing required trailing slash per URL convention.
issues.evidence: /learn/ro/en/en-romantic-phrases-for-every-occasion (no trailing slash)

issues.description: Minor: 'Stud' translation as 'Mascul atragator' is overly literal. The example 'Arati ca un mascul in costumul ala!' is awkward in Romanian. Better translation: 'Tip atragator'.
issues.evidence: word="Stud" translation="Mascul atragator" example="Arati ca un mascul in costumul ala!"

issues.description: Typo in Romanian prose: 'dintre' should be 'dintre'. The circumflex accent is archaic/incorrect in modern Romanian.
issues.evidence: Spaniola este considerata una dintre cele mai romantice limbi din lume

issues.description: Multiple VocabCards have Romanian words instead of Spanish. Target lang is 'es' but words like 'a se muta', 'apartament', 'chirie', 'bucatarie' are Romanian. Translations are in English instead of Romanian.
issues.evidence: word="a se muta" translation="to move" — should be word="mudarse" translation="a se muta"

issues.description: PhraseOfDay has Romanian word with English translation. Should have Spanish word with Romanian translation.
issues.evidence: word="Ne mutam impreuna!" translation="We're moving in together!"

issues.description: Multiple VocabCards have descriptive labels instead of phonetic pronunciations: 'schimbare de adresa', 'locuinta', 'plata lunara', 'loc de gatit', 'comunicare', 'sentiment de implinire'.
issues.evidence: pronunciation="schimbare de adresa", pronunciation="locuinta", pronunciation="plata lunara"

issues.description: The 'Expresii Utile' section provides English translations instead of Spanish. This is a Spanish-learning article for Romanian speakers.
issues.evidence: E randul tau sa... - It's your turn to... (should be: Es tu turno de...)

issues.description: Article about moving in together for Spanish learners contains mostly Romanian tables and lists with no Spanish vocabulary. Tables list room names, furniture, chores etc. all in Romanian only.
issues.evidence: Table rows: Living | Zona de relaxare, Dormitor | Pentru somn — all Romanian, no Spanish

issues.description: Multiple long academic filler paragraphs that describe what the section will cover instead of teaching content. These are AI meta-commentary with no educational value.
issues.evidence: Transformarea unui spatiu gol intr-un camin primitor incepe cu selectarea pieselor esentiale...

issues.evidence: word="La multi ani!" translation="Happy Birthday!" — should be word="Joyeux anniversaire!" translation="La multi ani!"

issues.description: PhraseOfDay word is in Romanian, translation is in English. Both are wrong for a French-learning article for Romanian speakers.
issues.evidence: word="La multi ani, iubirea mea!" translation="Happy Birthday, my love!"

issues.description: Typo in Romanian prose: 'dintre' with circumflex accent instead of modern 'dintre'.
issues.evidence: unul dintre cele mai frumoase si unice cuvinte portugheze

systemic_patterns: LANGUAGE DIRECTION REVERSAL (HIGH): Articles 1 (en-birthday), 3 (es-moving-in), and 5 (fr-birthday) have VocabCard words in Romanian instead of the target language, with translations in English instead of Romanian. This affects ~25% of all articles and is the most critical systemic issue.

FAKE PRONUNCIATIONS (HIGH): Articles 1, 3, and 5 use descriptive labels ('urare clasica', 'schimbare de adresa', 'romantic') instead of actual phonetic guides in the pronunciation field. These provide zero learning value to the reader.
MISSING IMPORT STATEMENTS: 7 out of 12 articles (1, 3, 5, 7, 8, 9, 10) lack MDX import statements for VocabCard, CultureTip, and PhraseOfDay. Only articles 0, 2, 4, 6, 11 have proper imports.

FILLER PARAGRAPHS (MEDIUM): Articles 1, 3, and 5 contain long AI-generated meta-commentary paragraphs that describe what sections will cover rather than teaching anything. These read like academic abstracts and add no learning value.

TEMPLATE DUPLICATION: The birthday articles (1=en, 5=fr) share identical Romanian prose structure, bullet points, tips, and letter templates. The French birthday article is essentially the English one with a few French VocabCards injected. Neither article substantively teaches its target language.

THIN GOOD-MORNING ARTICLES: Articles 7 (de) and 10 (pt) are extremely thin with only 3 VocabCards each and ~150 words. They share an identical structure template and both have mismatched CultureTips about apologies instead of greetings.
INTERNAL LINK ISSUES: Articles 7 and 10 use wrong URL prefix /ro/{lang}/ instead of /learn/ro/{lang}/. All internal links across articles 1, 3, 5, 7, 10 are missing required trailing slashes.

CLEAN ARTICLES: Articles 0 (en-pet-names), 2 (es-romantic-phrases), 4 (fr-romantic-phrases), 6 (de-romantic-phrases), 8 (it-meeting-family), 9 (it-date-night except table bug), and 11 (pt-i-love-you except minor issues) demonstrate the quality baseline — VocabCards have target-language words, Romanian translations, genuine phonetic pronunciations, and real example sentences.
